paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on the Val30Met mutation in the TTR gene associated with hereditary transthyretin amyloidosis.

patients.phenotype: hereditary transthyretin amyloidosis (hATTR) with gastrointestinal symptoms, peripheral neuropathy, and hematologic abnormalities

individual_records.phenotype_details: presented with diarrhea, mild anemia, and symptoms of peripheral neuropathy
individual_records.evidence_sentence: Genetic testing confirmed a Val30Met mutation of the TTR gene consistent with hereditary TTR amyloidosis (hATTR).

functional_data.summary: The mutation leads to misfolding of the TTR protein, contributing to amyloid deposition.

variants.evidence_level: Strong evidence based on clinical presentation and genetic confirmation.
variants.additional_notes: The patient was started on patisiran therapy after diagnosis.
key_quotes: Genetic testing confirmed a Val30Met mutation of the TTR gene consistent with hereditary TTR amyloidosis (hATTR).

extraction_metadata.notes: The extraction was straightforward as the paper provided clear information on the TTR variant.
